20.title: multiple nodes on the same spot
20.description: There is more than one node in this spot. Offending node IDs: $1

30.title: non-closed_areas
30.description: This way is tagged with '$1' and should be closed-loop.

40.title: dead-ended one-ways
40.description: The first node (id $1) of this one-way is not connected to any other way

41.description: The last node (id $1) of this one-way is not connected to any other way

42.description: This node cannot be reached because one-ways only lead away from here

43.description: You cannot escape from this node because one-ways only lead to here

50.title: almost-junctions
50.description: This node is very close but not connected to way #$1
50.regex: (this node) is very close but not connected to way #(\d+)

60.title: deprecated tags
60.description: This $1 uses deprecated tag $2. Please use $3 instead!

72.description: This node is not member of any way and does not have any tags

73.description: This way has a $1 tag but no highway tag

75.description: This (node|way|relation) has a name \((.+)\) but no other tag

90.title: motorways without ref
90.description: This way is tagged as motorway and therefore needs a ref nat_ref or int_ref tag

100.title: places of worship without religion
100.description: This $1 is tagged as place of worship and therefore needs a religion tag

110.title: point of interest without name
110.description: This node is tagged as $1 and therefore needs a name tag

120.title: ways without nodes
120.description: This way has just one single node

130.title: floating islands
130.description: This way is not connected to the rest of the map

150.title: railway crossing without tag
150.description: This crossing of a highway and a railway needs to be tagged as railway=crossing or railway=level_crossing

160.title: wrongly used railway tag
160.description: There are ways in different layers coming together in this railway crossing. There are ways tagged as tunnel or bridge coming together in this railway crossing

170.title: FIXME tagged items
170.description: This feature has a FIXME tag: (.*)

180.title: relations without type
180.description: This relation has no type tag which is mandatory for relations

190.title: intersections without junctions
190.description: This $1 intersects the $2 #$3 but there is no junction node

210.title: loopings
210.description: These errors contain self intersecting ways

211.description: This way contains more than one node at least twice. Nodes are $1.
211.regex: (this way) contains more than one node at least twice. Nodes are ((?:#\d+(?:, )?)+)\.

212.description: This way has only two different nodes and contains one of them more than once

220.title: misspelled tags
220.description: This $1 is tagged '$2' where $3 looks like $4

221.description: The key of this $1's tag is 'key': $2

230.title: layer conflicts
230.description: This node is a junction of ways on different layers.

231.title: mixed layers intersection
231.description: This node is a junction of ways on different layers: $1
231.regex: (this node) is a junction of ways on different layers: (.+)

232.title: strange layers
232.description: This $1 is tagged with layer $2. This need not be an error, but it looks strange

270.title: motorways connected directly
270.description: This node is a junction of a motorway and a highway other than motorway, motorway_link, trunk, rest_area or construction. Service or unclassified is only valid if it has access=no/private or it leads to a motorway service area or if it is a service=parking_aisle.

280.title: boundaries
280.description: Administrative Boundaries can be expressed either by tagging ways or by adding them to a relation. They should be closed-loop sequences of ways, they must not self-intersect or split and they must have a name and an admin_level.

282.title: missing admin level
282.description: The boundary of $1 has no (?:valid numeric)?admin_level

283.title: no closed loop
283.description: The boundary of $1 is not closed-loop

285.title: admin_level too high
285.description: This boundary-way has admin_level $1 but belongs to a relation with lower admin_level (higher priority); it should have the lowest admin_level of all relations

290.title: restrictions
290.description: Analyses all relations tagged type=restriction or following variations type=restriction:hgv type=restriction:caravan type=restriction:motorcar type=restriction:bus type=restriction:agricultural type=restriction:motorcycle type=restriction:bicycle and type=restriction:hazmat

292.title: missing from way
292.description: This turn-restriction needs exactly one from member. This one has $1

293.title: missing to way
293.description: This turn-restriction needs exactly one to member. This one has $1

294.title: from or to not a way
294.description: From- and To-members of this turn-restriction need to be ways. $1

295.title: via is not on the way ends
295.description: via (node #$1) is not the first or the last member of (from|to) (way #$3)

296.title: wrong restriction angle
296.description: This turn-restriction type is $1, but angle is $2 degrees. Maybe the restriction type is not appropriate?

298.title: already restricted by oneway
298.description: entry already prohibited by oneway tag on $1

300.title: missing maxspeed
300.description: This highway is missing a maxspeed tag

310.title: roundabouts
310.description: Analyses ways with tag junction=roundabout. More then one way can form a roundabout. It supports tag oneway=-1

311.title: not closed loop
311.description: This way is part of a roundabout but is not closed-loop. (split carriageways approaching a roundabout should not be tagged as roundabout)

312.title: wrong direction
312.description: If this ((?:mini_)?roundabout) is in a country with (left|right)-hand traffic then its orientation goes the wrong way around

313.title: faintly connected
313.description: This roundabout has only $1 other roads connected. Roundabouts typically have three

320.title: *_link connections
320.description: This way is tagged as highway=$1_link but doesn't have a connection to any other $1 or $1_link
320.regex: (this way) is tagged as (highway=.+) but doesn't have a connection to any other (.+) or (.+)

350.title: bridge-tags
350.description: This bridge does not have a tag in common with its surrounding ways that shows the purpose of this bridge. There should be one of these tags: (.+)
350.NOTE: Group can be arbitrary list of form: key=value,key=value,key=value...

360.title: language unknown
360.description: It would be nice if this (node|way|relation) had an additional tag 'name:XX=(.+)' where XX shows the language of its name '\2'

370.title: doubled places
370.description: This node has tags in common with the surrounding way #$1 ((?:\(including the name '.+'\) )?)and seems to be redundand
370.regex: (this node) has tags in common with the surrounding way #(\d+) ((?:\(including the name '.+'\) )?)and

380.title: non-physical use of sport-tag
380.description: This way is tagged sport=$1 but has no physical tag like e.g. leisure, building, amenity or highway

390.title: missing tracktype
390.description: This track doesn''t have a tracktype

401.title: missing turn restriction
401.description: ways $1 and $2 join in a very sharp angle here and there is no oneway tag or turn restriction that prevents turning( from way (\1|\2) to (\1|\2))?

402.title: impossible angles
402.description: this way bends in a very sharp angle here

410.title: website
410.description: Web pages are analyzed. Web page is defined by any of the following tags website=* url=* website:mobile=* contact:website=* contact:url=* image=* source:website=* or source:url=*

411.title: http error
411.description: The URL ($1) cannot be opened (HTTP status code $2)

412.title: domain hijacking
412.description: Possible domain squatting: $1. Suspicious text is: "$2"

413.title: non-match
413.description: Content of the URL ($1) did not contain these keywords: ($2)
